de.must.markup
Class HalfDataComboBox

java.lang.Object
  de.must.markup.MustInputField
      de.must.markup.HalfDataComboBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
DataChangeListener, Markupable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DataComboBox
public class HalfDataComboBox
extends MustInputField
implements DataChangeListener

ComboBox field with data from table.

reduceContent

public void reduceContent(java.lang.String whereCondition)
Reduces the content of the combo box by adding a where condition to the select statement of the content date object and recall of the fillFromContentDataObject method. Applicable only for the combo box filled from database.

Parameters:
whereCondition - the where condition to use

destroy

public final void destroy()
Description copied from interface: Markupable
Destroys the markupable. Useful to release e.g. static references which prevent the garbage collector from finalizing. For example HalfDataComboBoxes add themeselves as Listeners to database changes. These listeners are registered statically. Thus, these listeners cannot be removed by the garbage collector, they have to be removed manually. This may be done by calling this destroy method.

Specified by:
destroy in interface Markupable
Overrides:
destroy in class MustInputField
See Also:
Markupable.destroy()

free

protected void free()
Frees external resources. May be called manually without waiting for the garbage collector.

finalize

protected final void finalize()
                       throws java.lang.Throwable
Called by the garbage collector. Calls free if the frame has not already been destroyed. Override free to add further releases and don't forget to call super.free() at the end.

Overrides:
finalize in class java.lang.Object
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable
See Also:
free(), destroy()
